alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 13 at 2:49AM CST until December 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts Tonight Through Thursday.. .A strong winter storm affects northern Wisconsin between this evening and Thursday. A wintry mix of freezing rain and snow arrives tonight. By Wednesday morning, two to three tenths of ice may coat roadways, trees, and power lines. Travel will likely be hazardous. This ice, coupled with strong winds gusting to 35 to 45 mph, may result in localized tree damage and power outages. Snow sets in by Wednesday morning with a prolonged light to moderate snowfall through Thursday. This forecast is very sensitive to temperatures, which will be right near freezing. If temperatures warm a few degrees above freezing, icing will be reduced. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of one tenth to quarter of an inch are possible. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches and further ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
